titles: His Majesties second message sent to the Parliament concerning Sir John Hothams refusall to give His Majestie entrance into his town of Hull. 28. April. 1642
author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I)
Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
publisher: by Robert Barker, printer to the Kings most excellent Majesty: and by the assignes of John Bill,
notes: Calls on Parliament for justice on Sir John Hotham at Hull, being assured that though they put a garrison in it to guard it against papists, it was not against their Sovereign--Steele.
Arms 30; Steele notation: all  the  with.
Reproduction of original in the Folger Shakespeare Library, Washington, D.C.
keywords: Hotham, John, --  Sir, d. 1647 Jan. 2 --  Early works to 1800.
Great Britain --  History --  Civil War, 1642-1649 --  Early works to 1800.
